programme.title: The Curse of Oak Island
programme.desc: Rick and Marty Lagina make a discovery at Smith's Cove that promises to help them solve the mystery of the Money Pit.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: The team turns a petrol pump into a beer cooler and restore a sign from a 1970s fast food restaurant.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: Singer Jason Mraz asks Rick to help him restore a sign as a tribute to his late grandfather.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: Baseball stars Tommy Lasorda, Ron Cey and Paul Lo Duca challenge Rick to transform a 1950s drinks cooler into a hot dog cart.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: Rick challenges a potential new recruit to prove his worth by restoring a scooter.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike and Frank are intrigued by a mysterious locked trunk when they visit the former home of a circus, and a zebra-print motorcycle also catches their eye.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: R&R's helicopter is taken out of action by inclement weather, leaving the company with serious problems.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: Helicopter logging suffers under the control of a new pilot, the underdogs finally get their big chance, and the men of Pihl Logging are given the opportunity to deal with the biggest timber of their careers.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: A collector of rare memorabilia asks for a job and the team work on restoring a sign from a 1940s petrol station.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: The crew restores an ejector seat from a 1950s jet fighter, while Brettly works on a popcorn machine.

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: Compilation looking back at highlights of past episodes of the comedy quiz hosted by Dara O Briain, with regular panellists Hugh Dennis, Andy Parsons and Chris Addison. From 2012.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Comedians Dave Gorman and Omid Djalili, TV presenter Davina McCall and journalist Janet Street-Porter join team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack on the comedy panel show, in which they try to dupe their opponents with plausible lies about themselves. Presented by Rob Brydon.

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programme.sub-title: Have I Got a Bit More Old News for You
programme.desc: Actress Tracey Ullman hosts an extended edition of the satirical quiz from April 2018, with comedian James Acaster and Sky News journalist Beth Rigby joining team captains Ian Hislop and Paul Merton to poke fun at the week's news.

programme.title: Not Going Out
programme.desc: Lee Mack and Sally Bretton star in the domestic comedy which sees the couple appear to go from one disaster to the next, while coping with their three kids, Lucy's disapproving parents, Lee's feckless dad Frank and their world-weary friends Toby and Anna. This week the couple become addicted to a TV box set, causing them to cancel dinner with Toby and Anna at the last moment. But when they lie about the reason, it only succeeds in opening up a huge can of worms. Domestic comedy, with Hugh Dennis and Abigail Cruttenden.

programme.title: Zapped
programme.desc: Brian has found the magical amulet that can potentially send him home - but it doesn't work. Howell tricks him into getting a book from the oddly menacing Munty Library.

programme.title: Zapped
programme.desc: In the final episode, Brian joins the Munty Reserve forces, while Barbara and Steg find their own groups to enlist with.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Steam Train Britain
programme.desc: Great Central Railway's Scott Manley takes a rainy busman's holiday working as a guard at Bury, while a team of volunteers in Wales try to keep the line clear of overgrown plants.

programme.title: Underground Worlds
programme.desc: Exploring the military headquarters built beneath Dover Castle during the Second World War and Odessa's catacombs, possibly the largest tunnel network in the world.

programme.title: Find My Past
programme.desc: The relatives of a wireless operator, a passenger and a steward discover how their ancestors' lives intertwined on board the ill-fated Titanic in 1912. Presented by Chris Hollins.

programme.title: Find My Past
programme.desc: Chris Hollins invites three people, including the nephew and grandson of two RAF pilots, learn about the role their forebears played in the Battle of Britain.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: The Heart Guy
programme.desc: April is pregnant, and not everyone is as supportive as Matt had hoped, but the netball game between the hospital and mining company takes all the focus.

programme.title: Gregory's Girl (1981)
programme.desc: A gawky teenager is dismayed to be relegated to goalkeeper in the school football team - but his thoughts turn to romance once he meets the female striker who takes his place. However, his awkward nature proves an obstacle to winning her over, despite the sage advice of his worldly-wise little sister. Comedy, starring John Gordon Sinclair, Dee Hepburn, Jake D'Arcy, Clare Grogan and Robert Buchanan.

programme.title: A Place to Call Home
programme.desc: Sarah leads the charge to rescue James, whose ordeal continues when his sexuality becomes known, and puts her relationship with George at risk when a disturbing discovery forces her to reveal her darkest secret.

programme.title: A Place to Call Home
programme.desc: Sarah reveals her horrific secret to George, and their relationship is suddenly thrown into doubt. The Christmas soiree brings out Jack's intimacy issues, and Anna publicly humiliates Andrew. Romantic drama, starring Marta Dusseldorp.

programme.title: You've Been Framed!
programme.desc: Harry Hill narrates a comical selection of mishaps filmed by viewers, featuring cats and their killer claws, makeshift dance floors and testing Newton's Laws.

programme.title: Tenable
programme.desc: Five friends from Newcastle answer questions about top 10 lists from the realms of pop culture and general knowledge, then try to score a perfect 10 in the final round to take home the prize money. Quiz, hosted by Warwick Davis.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: The Ultimate Christmas Party
programme.desc: We've got that Christmas feeling and those party vibes! Here are some of the ultimate party tracks to kick off your Christmas party.

programme.title: That Christmas Feeling
programme.desc: Once again the famous Magic Christmas provides the soundtrack to your seasonal celebrations. We'll be playing all your festive favourites until you've finished your final turkey sandwich.

programme.title: Takin' It Old Skool
programme.desc: We're takin' you back to the old skool with some of the best tracks from the last few decades.

programme.title: Up All Night! Kiss Beats
programme.desc: Let the world sleep! But here at Kiss we are still up, still delivering the finest beats for your nocturnal jam.

programme.title: Super Hits & New Releases!
programme.desc: Tune in to these super-hot hits and the latest trending videos. Look no further for today's music fix.

programme.title: All The Hits, All Night
programme.desc: Non-stop hits to see you all the way through the night.

programme.title: Combat Dealers
programme.desc: Military equipment collector Bruce Crompton recreates a D-Day parachute jump in a genuine Second World War uniform.

programme.title: The Unexplained Files
programme.sub-title: Death from the Sky and Mexican Chupacabra
programme.desc: A dead body inexplicably appears as if it has fallen from the sky. Plus, mysterious attacks leave livestock drained of their blood.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Car restorer Wayne Carini has a 1931 Cadillac ready for auction, and is asked to restore the brakes on a re-creation of a 1937 Bugatti Atlantique.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Wayne Carini takes his newly restored 1964 Ferrari Lusso and 1957 Mercedes 300SL Gullwing to an auction in Scottsdale.

programme.title: Wheels That Fail
programme.desc: Real-life footage of road-based disasters, including hair-raising near misses, high-octane police chases and disastrous car accidents.

programme.title: Wheels That Fail
programme.desc: Real-life footage of road-based disasters, including hair-raising near misses, high-octane police chases and disastrous car accidents.

programme.title: Destroyed in Seconds
programme.desc: Massive explosions rip through a Brazilian chemical plant forcing local residents to flee for their lives, and an accident on an aircraft carrier sends a jet crashing into the sea.

programme.title: Destroyed in Seconds
programme.desc: A tornado causes destruction in Kansas and a freak accident catapults a racer into the path of a speeding boat. Presented by Ron Pitts.

programme.title: Fifth Gear
programme.desc: Jonny Smith and Jason Plato try to find a decent new car for just Â£10,000. Vicki Butler-Henderson checks out the new Lamborghini Urus, and the team finds the biggest BMW ever made, the new X7.

programme.title: Overhaulin'
programme.desc: Chip Foose and the A-Team restore a newly retired teacher's 1954 pickup truck that he has put off investing in until his twin daughters' college tuition has been paid for.

programme.title: Dahmer on Dahmer: A Serial Killer Speaks
programme.desc: Part one of two. Journalist Nancy Glass investigates the crimes of American serial killer and sex offender Jeffery Dahmer, who committed the rape, murder, and dismemberment of 17 men and boys from 1978 to 1991.

programme.title: Dahmer on Dahmer: A Serial Killer Speaks
programme.desc: Nancy Glass investigates one of history's most terrifying cases, 25 years on from Jeffrey Dahmer confessing to 17 gruesome murders that shook America to its core.

programme.title: Murder on CCTV
programme.desc: The case of Louisiana student Mickey Shunick, who went missing after a night out in May 2012. Police failed to make a breakthrough until they spoted her on surveillance footage. Eventually a registered sex offender pleaded guilty to killing the 21-year-old, and also being responsible for the death of another woman whose body had been found in September 1999.

programme.title: Murder Comes to Town
programme.desc: How the double homicide of a young mother and her baby daughter sent Galax's tiny police force on a frenzied mission to stop unspeakable evil in its tracks.

programme.title: FBI Files
programme.desc: The agents face a difficult challenge in the form of a band of political extremists that has pulled off two major bank robberies with precision.

programme.title: Animal Cops Phoenix
programme.desc: A police officer spots a pony wandering along the motorway, and the team tries to locate its owner.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Chris Brown and Lisa Chimes head out to the Blue Mountains after some of the most intense bushfires on record, to help pets and wildlife in the fire zone.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Injured army vet Shealynn is treated to a surprise when comedian Seth Meyers turns up, while model Ashley wants a slinky dress that also gets the approval of her father.
